body: Would a `Set<String> keySet()` that you could filter for the engine's prefix also work for you? Returning all keys would include all system properties, though, and hence would be inconsistent with `size()` which currently only takes into account explicit configuration parameters passed as part of the discovery request. Technically, we could change the semantics of `size()` but I'm not sure who relies on the current behavior. Thoughts?
Tentatively slated for 5.8 M1 solely for the purpose of _team discussion_.

`keySet()` would work for me.

As for `size()`, I never understood its intention in the first place. What are typical intended use cases?

That's a good question. It looks like it was added for testing in https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/commit/6d3cbe6240ef9bcc2aec860f0400a6edd0bdd6bf.

Thus, I think changing it's semantics or even deprecating it would be fine.

**Team decision:** Let's introduce `keySet()` and deprecate `size()`.

@jlink Do you have time to submit a PR for this?

rename.from: Add capability to get all configuration parameters with given prefix
rename.to: Add capability to get all configuration parameters

issue.title: Add `keySet()` method on `ConfigurationParameters` to retrieve all parameter keys

repository.name: junit-framework
repository.description: âœ… The programmer-friendly testing framework for Java and the JVM

issue.body:
## Overview

Add `keySet()` method on `ConfigurationParameters` and deprecate `size()`.

Resolves #2520.

---

I hereby agree to the terms of the [JUnit Contributor License Agreement](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/002a0052926ddee57cf90580fa49bc37e5a72427/CONTRIBUTING.md#junit-contributor-license-agreement).

---

### Definition of Done

- [ ] There are no TODOs left in the code
- [ ] Method [preconditions](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/api/org.junit.platform.commons/org/junit/platform/commons/util/Preconditions.html) are checked and documented in the method's Javadoc
- [ ] [Coding conventions](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#coding-conventions) (e.g. for logging) have been followed
- [ ] Change is covered by [automated tests](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#tests) including corner cases, errors, and exception handling
- [ ] Public API has [Javadoc](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5/blob/HEAD/CONTRIBUTING.md#javadoc) and [`@API` annotations](https://apiguardian-team.github.io/apiguardian/docs/current/api/org/apiguardian/api/API.html)
- [ ] Change is documented in the [User Guide](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/) and [Release Notes](https://junit.org/junit5/docs/snapshot/user-guide/#release-notes)
- [ ] All [continuous integration builds](https://github.com/junit-team/junit5#continuous-integration-builds) pass
